content.question:
Aeneas laments a disastrous decision.

“O patria, o divumdivum = divorum domus Ilium et inclutainclutus, -a, -um: famous, renowned bello

moenia Dardanidum!Dardanis, Dardanidis, m.: Dardanian, Trojan Quaterquater: four times ipso in limine portae

substititsubsisto, subsistere, substiti: halt, stop, come to a stop atque utero sonitum quater arma dedere;

instamus tamen immemores caecique furore

et monstrum infelix sacrata sistimussisto, sistere: place, set, set up arce.”

Aeneid 2. 241-245

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.

frqParts.text:
Aeneas laments a disastrous decision.

“O patria, o divumdivum = divorum domus Ilium et inclutainclutus, -a, -um: famous, renowned bello

moenia Dardanidum!Dardanis, Dardanidis, m.: Dardanian, Trojan Quaterquater: four times ipso in limine portae

substititsubsisto, subsistere, substiti: halt, stop, come to a stop atque utero sonitum quater arma dedere;

instamus tamen immemores caecique furore

et monstrum infelix sacrata sistimussisto, sistere: place, set, set up arce.”

Aeneid 2. 241-245

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.
